title: `milagro_bls_binding` fails to install on arm64
body:
The `milagro_bls_binding==1.6.3` python module does not seem to exist for arm64 systems.

```
ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement milagro_bls_binding==1.6.3 (from eth2spec[test])
ERROR: No matching distribution found for milagro_bls_binding==1.6.3
```

If you attempt to install `milagro_bls_binding` outside of `make install_test`, it will provide a list of available versions:

```
(from versions: 0.1.4, 0.4.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.1, 1.8.0)
```

And `1.6.3` is missing from this list.

## Dockerfile

```Dockerfile
FROM --platform=linux/arm64 debian:bullseye

#
# Install dependencies.
#
RUN apt update
RUN apt install -y gcc git make python3-dev python3-venv wget

#
# Grab the consensus-specs.
#
RUN git clone https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs.git
WORKDIR consensus-specs

#
# Test.
#
CMD make install_test
```
@jtraglia @ralexstokes  Sorry, the 1.6.3 has no arm64 support yet. Does changing it to 1.8.0 work for you? If so, we should bump the version.

Yes, but not without some hiccups. Version `1.8.0` does not have a pre-built wheel, so pip will build it. This requires the rust compiler be installed; but rust stable does not work, it requires rust nightly.

@jtraglia I plan to issue a release 1.8.1 to support linux/arm64 and file a PR here. Also, attempt to use stable rust for it. It might take some days.
